   20: 
   21: %%
   22: 
   23: -module(ssh_chan_behaviours_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include("ssh.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -export([
   30:          suite/0,
   31:          all/0,
   32:          init_per_suite/1,
   33:          end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_testcase/2,
   35:          end_per_testcase/2
   36:         ]).
   37: 
   38: -export([
   39:          defined_subsystem/1,
   40:          noexist_subsystem/1,
   41:          subsystem_client/1,
   42:          undefined_subsystem/1
   43:         ]).
   44: 
   45: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   46: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   47: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap,{seconds,60}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [
   55:      noexist_subsystem,
   56:      undefined_subsystem,
   57:      defined_subsystem,
   58:      subsystem_client
   59:     ].
   60: 
   61: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   62: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   63:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
   64:        begin
   65:            ssh:start(),
   66:            Config
   67:        end).
   68: 
   69: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   70:     {Time,R} = timer:tc(ssh, stop, []),
   71:     ct:log("Stop ssh: ~p ms",[(100*(Time div 1000)) / 100]),
   72:     R.
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
   75:     SubSystems = [
   76:                   {"bad_cb", {ssh_chan_behaviours_undefined, []}}, % A non-existing file
   77:                   {"ch1",    {ssh_chan_behaviours_server,    [self(),true]}}
   78:                  ],
   79:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{subsystems,SubSystems}]),
   80:     C = ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port, []),
   81:     [{connref,C}, {daemon_pid,Pid}| Config].
   82: 
   83: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
   84:     {Time,_} = timer:tc(ssh, stop_daemon, [proplists:get_value(daemon_pid,Config)]),
   85:     ct:log("Stop daemon: ~p ms",[(100*(Time div 1000)) / 100]),
   86:     case flush() of
   87:         [] -> ok;
   88:         Msgs -> ct:log("Unhandled messages:~n~p", [Msgs])
   89:     end.
   90:     
   91: 
   92: -define(EXPECT(What, Bind),
   93:             (fun() ->
   94:                      receive What ->
   95:                              ct:log("~p:~p ~p got ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),What]),
   96:                              Bind
   97:                      after 5000 ->
   98:                              ct:log("~p:~p ~p Flushed:~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),flush()]),
   99:                              ct:fail("Timeout!",[])
  100:                      end
  101:              end)()
  102:         ).
  103: 
  104: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  105: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  106: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  107: %% Try start a subsystem whose name is not known by the server
  108: noexist_subsystem(Config) ->
  109:     C = proplists:get_value(connref, Config),
  110:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
  111:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(C, Ch, "noexist", infinity),
  112:     ok = ssh_connection:close(C, Ch),
  113:     ?EXPECT({ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}},[]),
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: %% Try to start a subsystem with a known name, but without any callback file
  117: undefined_subsystem(Config) ->
  118:     C = proplists:get_value(connref, Config),
  119:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
  120:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(C, Ch, "bad_cb", infinity),
  121:     ok = ssh_connection:close(C, Ch),
  122:     ?EXPECT({ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}},[]), % self() is instead of a proper channel handler
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: %% Try to start and stop a subsystem with known name and defined callback file
  126: defined_subsystem(Config) ->
  127:     C = proplists:get_value(connref, Config),
  128:     {ok, Ch1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
  129: 
  130:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(C, Ch1, "ch1", infinity),
  131:     IDsrv = ?EXPECT({{Csrv,Ch1srv}, {ssh_channel_up,Ch1srv,Csrv}}, {Csrv,Ch1srv}),
  132: 
  133:     ok = ssh_connection:close(C, Ch1),
  134:     ?EXPECT({IDsrv, {terminate,normal}}, []),
  135:     ?EXPECT({ssh_cm, C, {closed,Ch1}}, []), % self() is instead of a proper channel handler
  136:     ok.
  137: 
  138: %% Try to start and stop a subsystem from a ssh_client_channel behaviour
  139: subsystem_client(Config) ->
  140:     C = proplists:get_value(connref, Config),
  141: 
  142:     {ok,ChRef} = ssh_chan_behaviours_client:start_link(C),
  143:     IDclt = ?EXPECT({{C,Ch1clt},     {ssh_channel_up,_C1clt,C}},     {C,Ch1clt}),
  144:     IDsrv = ?EXPECT({{Csrv,_h1srv}, {ssh_channel_up,Ch1srv,Csrv}}, {Csrv,Ch1srv}),
  145: 
  146:     ok = ssh_chan_behaviours_client:stop(ChRef),
  147:     ?EXPECT({IDclt, {terminate,normal}}, []), % From the proper channel handler
  148:     ?EXPECT({IDsrv, {terminate,normal}}, []),
  149:     ok.
  150: 
  151: %%%================================================================
  152: %%%
  153: %%%
  154: 
  155: flush() -> lists:reverse(flush([])).
  156: 
  157: flush(Acc) ->
  158:     receive
  159:         M ->
  160:             flush([M|Acc])
  161:     after 0 ->
  162:             Acc
  163:     end.
  164:
